resource.chars:
auricular cavity can be “correctly described 
as a closed one, consisting at the half 
next the ventricle, of a beautifully plicated 
muscular coat in addition to the membranous 
one, but at the half next the venous 
sinus of venous membrane only: the latter 
might be termed the auricular sinus the 
former the auricle proper”
I can only suppose that ‘this delicate 
membrane of the venous sinuses’ is what I 
have called the ilio-parietal band 
in which the base of the auricle is as it 
were, set. Like a landing-net in its looks 
but this assuredly does <u>not<\u> close the base 
of the auricle which opens widely into the 
visceral chamber.
I <s>[text?]<\s> have equally failed in describing any 
arteries such as Prof. Owen describes continued 
from the species of the ventricles and I have 
the less hesitation in <s>[text?]<\s> supposing I have not overlooked them as Mr. Albany
